title: Mother-of-four, 32, spared jail after police found her FIVE times over limit
text:
Kyla Johnson (pictured outside Manchester Magistrates' Court), admitted drink driving

A mother-of-four downed a bottle of vodka and wine before getting behind the wheel of her car after an argument with her partner.

Kyla Johnson was reported missing by her family following the altercation at her home in Urmston, Greater Manchester on September 23.

Police officers searching for her found the 32-year-old at 9am, slumped behind the wheel of her car more than five times the limit, Manchester Magistrates' Court heard.

Johnson claimed she had woken up at the wheel and driven to an off licence but ran out of petrol and broke down on double yellow lines en route home.

A roadside breath test showed Johnson had 192 microgrammes of alcohol per 100 millilitres of breath. The legal alcohol limit for driving is 35mg.

Johnson admitted drink driving but avoided jail after revealing she had been suffering from depression which had been 'aggravated' following the birth of her fourth child.

Prosecutor James Gore told the court officers found Johnson 'intoxicated' and smelling of alcohol.

He added: 'There was half a bottle of vodka in the front seat and two further bottles, both empty, of vodka and wine.

'She admitted she had been drinking 20 minutes before. She said she has an alcohol problem and had started drinking after an argument with her partner.

'She said she had drunk alcohol all night in her car, slept in the vehicle and drove in the morning to an off licence.

'She tried to drive back but broke down with no petrol. She said that she was remorseful for her actions and was disgusted by her behaviour.'

Johnson will have to complete 20 rehabilitation days and pay £675 in costs. She was also banned from driving for three years

Johnson will have to complete 20 rehabilitation days and pay £675 in costs.

She was also banned from driving for three years after the magistrates described the alcohol level as 'horrific.'

Defence lawyer Adam Mir said: '[Johnson's] mental aspect falls short of requiring a hospital order but still requires intervention.

'The alcohol is used as a substitute for medication to subdue some of the more extreme aspects of depression that caused her suicidal thoughts.

'Given the fact that she is the mother of four children already, the impact of having her last child has aggravated her mental health condition.'

The magistrate told the mother-of-four: 'I know that you will be aware that custody has been seriously considered today.

'This was a horrific level of alcohol that you drank that night and you can't even imagine what damage you could have caused in that car.

'As we have heard you have children and I am sure you think about how you would feel if a drunk driver hit one of them.'
description: Kyla Johnson downed a bottle of vodka and wine before getting behind the wheel of her car after an argument with her partner at her home in Urmston, Greater Manchester.
